column5: I woke this morning with a few pains(sciatica), dying to get out for some fishing. I shouldnt of went at all. I was planning to hit the niagara, but with the way I felt I decided to stay close, pack lite and a very short walk to the trout grounds.  Within a 1/2 hr of fishing with all the bait fish lurking around, I had 2 lake trout sniff my lures and swam away  After a 1/2 hr or so of nothing to be seen, trout wise I moved on.  Within 20 minutes, I had an interested brown hunt down my lure, so interested he actually took it , a ten minute fight, he was landed  Shortly after I had a bow stare at my lures a few times, only to swim away on me It was very fustrating.As were my other 3 trips down there.  With all the bait fish present, im surprised he hit the lure. Glad he did though.  I guess this guy cant be entered for the 2011 tourney, oh well! He will enter my belly soon enough.  All I can say now is, Im glad I went, but Im paying for it now and probably in the am. OUCH!!!!!  A pic of the bait fish viewed threw my aquaview.
nothing like catching a tout for supper to make the pain in the back less annoying.   Nice going Vince.
Sciatica, nothing that a perc or two can't fix   while you're fishing,  nice chunky one.
A beer battered fillet should help

Awesome vince!! wheres the pic of the brownie? id like to see it.. We went to the old cut again today...sucked 2 fish all day and dinks at that..oh well congrats on the brown Edit, im on my bb and the pic didnt load...good job and nice fish!!
Awesome report and pics Vinni Congrats on the brown    She's a beauty Thanks for sharing Jacques
Thanks guys one problem, its 2 days before the tourney start  alls good , maybe next week
Any day fishing is a good day. You can pay for it later. I am Nice trout.
Well.... that's just too bad eh
Don't sweat it, you probably forgot your sign anyway Nice fish; at least you got out!!
